intro: Eugenia coolminiana, commonly known as the Coolminian tamarind, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, round, edible fruits that are typically red or yellow when mature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
